page.title: 08Ecology in Thornton Area
page.content: {Farmland.}The dipslope of the Limestone Tabular Hills rises gently to the north of the Pickering-Thornton road.The land makes excellent farmland and is extensively covered with large arable fields.In the face of pressure for land from commercial farming interests it is desirable to conserve some habitats in their natural condition. {Ellerburn.}Here there is a small nature reserve owned by the Yorkshire Wildlife Trust. On the bank top there are many orchids which have to be protected. Every year a course on ecology is organised by the {Workers' Education {Association,}and this consists of 10 evening lectures.
